candidates.title: Was Kirk Cameron Diagnosed With a Rare Form of Leprosy?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actor Kirk Cameron has contracted an extremely rare form of leprosy.
On 26 July 2017, TheLastLineOfDefense.com published a shocking article about an unexpected diagnosis for former child actor Kirk Cameron:
Actor, musician, director and devoted follower of Christ, Kirk Cameron, has been stricken with an extremely rare form of what can only be described as a biblical disease. Cameron has a mutated form of leprosy that is so rare, less than one in 600 million people will ever encounter someone who has it.
The strain, leprosis metapupalis carnivore, essentially turns its victim into a walking pile of dead skin, rotting flesh, and festering organs while keeping the brain functioning at primal levels and the heart pumping just enough to send diseased blood to the marrow and muscles to allow the person to be mobile.
This is not a genuine news item. TheLastLineOfDefense.com is an entertainment web site that does not publish factual stories, and carries multiple disclaimers labeling its content as fiction:
In a cynical world where the news of the day often seems fake, The Last Line of Defense offers today's busy conservative a place to go to read things they'll enjoy and congregate with a bunch of people they agree with. So while everything on this site is a satirical work of fiction, we are proud to present it to those who will have called it real anyway.
DISCLAIMER: Americas Last Line of Defense is a satirical publication that may sometimes appear to be telling the truth. We assure you thats not the case. We present fiction as fact and our sources dont actually exist. Names that represent actual people and places are purely coincidental and all images should be considered altered and do not in any way depict reality.
In other words, if you believe this crap youre a real dumbass.
candidates.description: A shocking report about the former child actor was just another hoax from a well-known purveyor of satire.

result.explanation: The news caption's claim that Kirk Cameron has been stricken with an extremely rare biblical disease is sourced from a satirical website, TheLastLineOfDefense.com.  The article itself explicitly labels its content as fiction and includes multiple disclaimers stating that it is not factual.  Snopes.com confirms this satirical nature. Therefore, the caption's claim is not supported by reliable sources and is demonstrably false.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 (TheLastLineOfDefense.com) explicitly states that it is a satirical publication and that its content is fiction.  It contains disclaimers that the content is not factual.  Snopes.com verifies that TheLastLineOfDefense.com is a satirical website.

final_result.explanation: The internal check aligns the caption with the image by correctly identifying Kirk Cameron and his profession.  The description of Cameron as a 'devoted follower of Christ' is not directly verifiable from the image but doesn't contradict it either. However, the external check reveals a significant discrepancy.  The claim that Cameron has a 'rare biblical disease' originates from a satirical website (TheLastLineOfDefense.com), confirmed as such by Snopes.com.  This external evidence strongly refutes the caption's core claim.  The high confidence score in the internal check is based on the accurate depiction of Cameron in the image; however, this is heavily outweighed by the external evidence demonstrating that the central claim about his illness is completely fabricated.  The conflict arises because the internal assessment focuses on surface-level entity alignment while ignoring the factual accuracy of the caption's assertion.  A high confidence score of 9 is given because both internal and external checks are highly confident in their respective assessments, but the external check (verifying the source's reliability and the claim's falsity) overrides the internal check. There is overwhelming evidence that the caption is completely out of context and based on a satirical, false news report.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal check shows high confidence in entity alignment, but the external check reveals that the caption's central claim is false, originating from a satirical website. The external check significantly outweighs the internal check, indicating that the caption is out of context.
